metadata.title: CVE-2017-17806 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The HMAC implementation (crypto/hmac.c) in the Linux kernel before 4.14.8does not validate that the underlying cryptographic hash algorithm isunkeyed, allowing a local attacker able to use the AF_ALG-based hashinterface (CONFIG_CRYPTO_USER_API_HASH) and the SHA-3 hash algorithm(CONFIG_CRYPTO_SHA3) to cause a kernel stack buffer overflow by executing acrafted sequence of system calls that encounter a missing SHA-3initialization.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
